label: TZ04
info_overview:
This in-wall switch module is able to detect Instant power wattage (5~1500W) and overload wattage (1600~1700W) of connected light or appliances.

When detecting overload state, the Module will be disabled and its On/Off button will be lockout of which LED will flash quickly. However, disconnect and re-connect the Module will reset its overload condition to normal status.
info_inclusion: Pressing INCLUDE_BUTTON three times within 1.5 seconds will enter inclusion mode
info_exclusion: Pressing INCLUDE_BUTTON three times within 1.5 seconds will enter exclusion mode
category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: W meter report period
parameters.overview: If the setting is configured for 1 hour (value = 720), the device will report its instant power consumption every 1 hour to Z-Wave Controller. Unit: 5 seconds

parameters.label: kWh meter report period
parameters.overview:
If the setting is configured for 1 hour (value = 6), the device will report its total power consumption every 1 hour to Z-Wave Controller. 

Unit: 10 minutes

parameters.label: Selected endpoint
parameters.description: Which endpoint is addressed by the BASIC command class
parameters.overview: If the Controller is not using Multi_Channel command class to access the endpoint of TZ04, you may configure the endpoint value to react the Basic Command Class

parameters.label: Switch mode
parameters.overview:
Manual switch S1 and S2 can be set to Edge mode, Pulse mode or Edge-Toggle mode. The default value is Edge mode.

Edge mode: This mode is suitable for toggle (bi-stable) wall switches that have an indicator point on the switch and the position corresponds to the same state of relay 1 and relay 2. If the TZ04 relay changes state due to a Z-Wave command, the switch may need to be toggled twice (On->Off or Off->On) to change the relay state.

Pulse Mode: This mode is suitable for momentary contact type wall switches to change the state of relay 1 or relay 2.

Edge-Toggle mode: This mode is suitable for normal toggle (bi-stable) switches. Every time the state of the wall switch changes the state of relay 1 or relay 2 will also change.

parameters.label: Threshold of Watt for Load Caution
parameters.description: If threshold of wattage is reached, a meter report will be generated

parameters.label: Threshold of kWh for Load Caution
parameters.description: If threshold of kWh is reached, a Meter Report will be generated

parameters.label: Restore switch state mode
parameters.overview: Restores the switch state setting in case the device was disconnected from the power source.

parameters.label: Auto Off Timer
parameters.overview: Whenever the device switches to on, the auto off timer begin to count down. After the timer decrease to zero, it will switch off automatically.

parameters.label: RF off command mode
parameters.overview: Whenever a switch off command, BASIC_SET, BINARY_SWITCH_SET, SWITCH_ALL_OFF, is received, it could be interpreted as 4 kinds of commands.

parameters.label: Endpoint 3
parameters.overview: Multi-Channel Command is a good way to control relay1 and relay2 of TZ04 individually. The endpoint3 of TZ04 is related to both relay1 and relay2. In some condition it becomes redundant in Multi-Channel Command Class.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.
